author: {'steamid': '76561198014390093', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 3338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3307, 'last_played': 1461276716}
review:
Fun game, the water aspect is a fresh look for survival games. It has a rust legacy feel to it but with vehicles. Lag can get bad if the server you play doesnt do any restarts but it is very much playable. The building doesnt leave alot to the imagination but there is enough interesting stuff to build that will keep you going.

The vehicles in this game are really the big selling point for me. There are hovercrafts, helicopters, sea planes, jet skis, cargo ships, ect.. and you always spawn with a motorized raft.

It's only $18 bucks and if you dont like it within 2 hours of gameplay u get your money back. What do you have to lose?

author: {'steamid': '76561198065924168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1467660450}
review:
UPDATE JULY 24th 2017: I was scrolling through my reviews and saw this one again. The dev should've listened before his/her game got 59% on Steam!! Haha!!!

Hello everyone,
The dev gave me a free alpha key, and, unfortunately, I actually played this game. I have not been able to fully immerse myself into the world of hide-and-holdout, but there is still potential for this game. This potential is unmet, as of right now.
I left comments to help build the game, and here are a few of the comments between me and the dev(s):

Me:
Hello Devs,
I change my steam name frequently, so in-game I'm usually not of the same name, but I am apart of that SpiceBoyZ clan.
This game has some potential, potential to be a cliche survival game. I like the concept of aqua-warfare. The detail on the water is beautiful, if I may say. However, there are plenty of issues in this game, making me think it is not really ready for early access in two weeks.
Jump physics are garbage. I don't know if is supposed to be like that, but they just don't flow right. If I jump forwards, I don't want to be able to freely strafe left and right, or back and forth. It's just not realistic. Maybe you guys are just going for an arcade feel, if so, I would make the graphics more arcade-like, which would also make the game actually run smoothly on my computer. My friend has a GTX 970 and a 4690k can only run the game at around 40 fps... which is mind-boggling for this more simple, minecrafty-seeming game.
Physics in general are not really good. When I ram into a boat with a jet ski, part of me goes into the boat, part of the ski slips on the boat, and another part of me die on the inside.
I also hate that you can't cut down trees or other physical objects. It makes it as if there's not much to do in the game. What's the point of exploring if you're just going to find the same sCRAP everywhere?
Please don't turn this into a cliche survival game, especially one with little to nothing to do. If you want, you can contact me for more, if I find it.
Peace,
-Nav

Dev:
@nav61 First of all, I think your judgement is really severe after reading all this, it looks more like you are trying to discourage or hurt but nevermind ^^ Well - 1. We decided to use air control here because you jump alot in h2o, you have lots of jumps to perform from high places and let me tell you that when you die with four hours of farming only because you felt from a high place ... you're mad. And anyway I don't see how it can be a "bad" thing, as it is the very first "problem" you're talking about ^^, the realism has nothing to do with this as a smooth gameplay prevails - 2. "My friend has a GTX 970 and a 4690k can only run the game at around 40 fps..." ... you're a liar ^^ cause I have far less and I have 60 FPS most for the time with max settings - 3. I'm agree for the strange physics concerning the collisions between boats, but still, it has never been a true problem for the gameplay.. it's only an esthetic bias. - 4. Here I don't know if you're accusing the trees, but again, it isn't a matter of gameplay, but a personal judgement. It doesn't really matters if you can't take wood from palm trees if you can get it on something else, but okay, I'm agree that the game is kinda boring with less than 10 connected players. But you can also consider the fact that since the game will be released soon, I have spent the last months to make the basis more stable. I was not working on beautiful promises to finally release a totally bugged game. Well, maybe you're looking for another game, more realistic, more like you personally want. Finally, I'm sorry if i seem rude but you were kinda rude to me, as your review is based on pretty nothing. Even if I know that there are lots of things to develop still, that the game is still at its beginning, I know that if you really wanted to help the project, you would be proposing solutions, and not speaking about "garbage" or anything. I mean no offence, I am open to the critic, when it is founded. Peace as well :)

Me:
What is true though, about this game, is that there is a lot of potential. While playing with my friends, we have a real good time exploring and creating our base. There just feels like there's too much lack of contact, hence my description of my experience. Think of it this way... I wouldn't comment if I didn't care. I want this game to be good!

A link to find these comments (and other comments): https://trello.com/c/S6C6mo7D/371-you-can-leave-a-comment-here-to-report-a-bug#

Thank you for taking your time to read my feedback.

review:
Rapidement addictif, le concept est top, les crafts sont élaborés et très réalistes, il manque cependant une balance au niveau des ressources demandées pour les crafts : l'aluminium ne sert à rien comparer au steel et à l'iron!!

Je recommande ce jeu en équipe, bien trop dur en solo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120833147', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1491236377}
review:
This review is done on (4/14/2016)

Alright... where to start... I honestly have never wrote an honest review before but here goes...

DAY 1: It was just me, and I get my bearings of how the mechanics work and this is what I found out...

1. Resouces come from only scrap piles, floating logs, sharks, whales, floating garbage piles, and other players. 
2. press tab to build or craft
3. boats are your friends, if you don't have one so is land
4. The community is friendly to new players
cool right?

DAY 2: So I got my bearings and started on a swedish server and made my first hut.. not a bad hut but a shabby one made of sweat tears and a whole lot of resources. At the same time I buy two more of this game for my friends so they can see what I talk about on how cool this game is.

DAY 3&4: My friends join me in my hut we build walls, weapons, and finally jet skis, which in turn made gathering alot faster and more profitable. We met some friendly Canadians, and we weren't ready to defend ourselves so we didn't engage alot but we held firm, we got off for awhile and when we get back we realize we have been looted while we were gone and I realized I didn't build any windows to stop people from crouch jumping into our base so I did some remodeling to plug up the gaps. My compadres decide to use their newly built guns to exact revenge but hilariously they started this while there was a 3-faction war happening in the middle of the map between the "elites","UWS", and the "DOGS" and boy they had the guns. shortly after they lost our skis and their guns and whatever they had on them at the time, a raiding party of the "elites" had a massive ship and two skis come and loot us. The next part was hilarious to me when the second raiding party of the "UWS" came with a gun boat and two skis, we had to break the news that we were recently raided and had nothing to give them and pointed out that half of our tower's walls have been blown to smithereens. So in turn they went on their merry way east back to the warfront.

DAY 5: From experiencing the previous days I decided I was going to be the leader and vouch that we would have no personal weapons outside of our base other than harpoons and it has been peaceful since then so far. afterwards we focused more on electricity and base defenses rather than personal arsenal. the first defense was a tier 3 anti tank turret that could fit on a warship(we put it on a tower) and its ammo is stupid expensive but at least its devastating power is gruesome, plus if we don't have ammo at least its daunting. we made a windmill and now are currently focused on whale hunting and agriculture because we have realized we are actually not the biggest fish in the sea.

So those are my five days of gruesome playing and when I look back on this, this seems to be more of a story than an actual review... hopefully this gives kinda a picture of what it is like such as progression and for now notice these days are not real days but game days. We have actually been playing it about 3 days now and only 2 of them was with my friends so the progression and mining isn't too bad. I hope you enjoyed my drearily long review/story and I HIGHLY recommend this game more than most I play and definitly more than ark and this doesn't require a supercomputer to play. 

ENJOY!

                          -JangoXIII

author: {'steamid': '76561198100348290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1483204214}
review: I just bought this game today because my friend and I want to try it out since it looks like a fung game, like Rust. What a great choice that was! This game is in Early Access, but it is well fleshed out and has simple but fun mechanics. Just like I said previously, this game is like Rust, so there is a crafting system and guns and vehicles and building and clothing, but the one thing that is different, are the players; they are very kind and wont kill you right when they get the chance (or at least from my experience.) There are a few glitches with voicechat, a flying shark glitch (which is hilarious), and a flash light animation glitch, but all-in-all, nothing game breaking. In conclusion, if your looking for a fun new Multiplayer game with crafting and PVP, give H20 a try!

review:
玩了一天这游戏了，游戏蛮不错的，但是需要改进的地方很多
1、箱子里的东西不能一键捡起，或者鼠标双击捡起，这个很影响体验。
2、游戏人物无表情，动作僵硬，毫无生气。
3、游戏汉化这块希望官方尽快完善。只有中国人才能让这款游戏火起来。
4、希望有官方服务器，目前还全部是私人服务器，这让别人玩不长久。
5、等待后续继续体验

author: {'steamid': '76561197984599013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1579851098}
review:
First thing first, this game is fun. It is a LOT of fun. That said, it does need a whole lot of work. That is stating the obvious, as the game literally just came out a few days ago. Do not get discouraged by the glitches and bugs, as these are very normal. That said, my experiences have been mostly negative.

I started the game, which loads amazingly fast and runs like a dream for me, and found myself a nice quiet server to play on. The people on the server were extremely kind and quick to help me learn how to play and what to do with things. So off I go, mining up debris from the shore and being completely lost and confused in this amazing archipelago when I realized.. I'm about to starve! But that's ok because I have a busicuit! So I eat my tasty little bit of bread and realize.. I also have a raft! Sweeeeeet!
   A tiny bit of trial and error and a few embarassingly silly questions into map chat later.. and lookout world, I am afloat on the most AWESOME rigged up raft ever! Then things get even better when I find floating trash. WOO HOO! I got myself  some string and a car battery, couple other odd things.. and now I can make a fishing stick! I won't go into detail on how long it took me to figure out that cooking the fish makes them much better to eat.. but it took a while. I will go mention that at one point when I got off of the raft, I was attacked by a shark. I know what you are thinking.. "Hey, stupid, you just get out of the water." but no.. I tried that. You see, this shark was ON A MISSION! So there I am, squealing in panic, as this shark HOVERS out of the water and up a hill after me. It was very intense for a little while, but I did manage to pickaxe said smiley shark in the face.. to death.. and got some super tasty "Shark Chops" for my effort. Yummy.
     Now at this point I have a pretty good stockpile of resources from my adventures, and I will tell you now that it does not take long at all to build in this game. Four hours into the game and I had enough resources to build anything I wanted. So I build a small base and figure out how to make a small shipyard, and I made a jet ski. That's right! SPEEDY BOAT! And boy is it fun. There are whales too.. and you can jump these beefy guys with your jet ski for almost endless fun! And then.. get shot in the head from half way across the map by someone with a sniper rifle who you never even saw. Well that's ok, it is a "survival" game after all. Just.. you don't have to survive the world, you have to survive the people. That's fine.
  Back to the base finally because I forgot to build a cot, but the devs are kind enough to respan you with another super raft AND A BISCUIT! I found my jet ski again and got it home and then built myself the big ship yard. Now things are getting VERY good. Took me less then two hours to be in the big gunboat. I got to say.. driving that thing is FUN. It actually takes one person to steer while someone else runs the engine for you, making it a loooot of fun. Puttered around for a bit, refueled it at the refinery, went to head back home in the pitch dark. Now I didn't think much of this because I had a friend on the front of the boat with a flashlight.. then I am suddenly looking at the respawn timer again. Another headshot.. IN PITCH DARKNESS INSIDE THE CABIN OF A BOAT!
  By now I am somewhat annoyed.. but what the heck.. My buddy and I respawn and get the boat home.. only to find two guys waiting for us outside the base. Only.. we didn't know they were waiting for us. Because while we leave our game settings normal, meaning when it is night time it is DARK.. some people can still somehow see well enough to get two head shots almost instantly. They kill us, steal our boat, and leave.
  This should give you an idea of the player base. There are diamonds in the ruff, but within four hours I have been killed a half dozen times and every sintle one was a headshot. That doesn't seem like a coincodence to me, so be ready for that if/when you do start to play. All the same, we trundle on. By now I have about.. 12 hours in the game and I've built and driven pretty much every single vehicle in the game. Some are more fun than others, but all of them have their uses. I've also had most of them stolen from me. The game desperatly needs some sort of anti-cheat. Not to mention that the moment you log out, someone will come by and somehow demolish your metal walls in a few minutes, take everything you worked for, and be gone before you get back. 
  Pros : The game is FUN. Really fun. Even if you do loose everything, it doesn't take long to get it back. It is fast paced and when you loose something, it really is not a big deal. Aside from the sea plane, the vehicals are realistic to drive and a lot of fun to use. Flying sharks! Yes, I am counting that as a pro because it was so absolutley terrifying and hylarios to see that I think everyone should experience this.
  Cons : Cheating. Watch out for the players. A lot of them are legit.. but the cheaters are out there. No lights for your base. This means the cheaters can see you in the dark but you will not be able to see them coming for you. Base defenses MUST be manned to work. There is no automation so the moment you log out, everything you have is forfeit and will be taken from you. Not might be.. not could be.. but WILL be. You will have to start from scratch most days.. but at least it doesn't take very long.

   I would gladly promote this game to anyone who wants a nice fast pased game, but I would never label it as a survival game. It's very much more a FPS game with construction elements in it and a food bar you have to keep full with a very occasional bite to eat.


***UPDATE***

I logged back in after a good long break from the game just to see what was going on and wow has it been updated. They have overhauled the UI, worked over some of the crafting, and sadly.. the sharks no longer fly. I do miss the free shark meat delivery, but I suppose I don't mind dipping a toe in the water now and then to kill another one. Sadly, thef is a HUGE problem still, even on PvE servers. They do seem to have some sort of anti-cheat as well which is nice, though I'm not sure it works. Honestly, nobody plays this game any more. I suppose it was a combined issue of not enough content and rapid progression. You can build everything in a few hours if you put your mind to it and have some help and then you find yourself with nothing else to do. The development team seems to be extremely small, another sad factor which has drasticly slowed progress of the games development. I still hold out a lot of hope for the future of this title and the forums have a little activity on them here and there so at least someone else is enjoying it.

review:
Oyun daha gelişme aşamasında. Oyunu alacak olursanız pek bir şey beklemeyin. Çıkalı çok olmadı ama güzel fikir ve gelecek vaadi ile gelmiş bir oyun. Dinamikler mekanikler daha oturmamış. Şu an alırsaniz hem görsel açıdan hemde buglar yönünden  pek beğeneceğinizi pek düşünmüyorum. 

Kendi görüşüm : Oyun gelecek vaad ediyor. Aldım oynadım. Bir kenarda duruyor. Max 2-3 aya kadar güzel bir oyun olma yönünde harika adımlar atabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095306989', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1552729008}
review:
I'm aware i've only played 2.5 hours at this point however i've spent most of my time discovering/exploring everything the landscape has to offer, on the way i've encountered several people eager to throw their harpoon at my makeshift-raft and the aspiration of coming back soon with my friends to ultimately destroy them from the depths makes me excited to get things rolling, that being said so far this game offers almost ZERO PvE content, other than defending yourself from shark whilst exploring caves to essentially build up a huge PvP vessel to my understanding (though there are huge whale roaming the oceans and i have yet to see what these bad boys offer in regards to challenge and resources) This game's bread and butter is PvP. when your head dips below the surface of the water, i almost immediately freak out as the sense of misdirection and urgency beneath the waves seems increasingly intense, not to mention all the resources i've seen at the bottom of the ocean beds taunting you, until you realize after stepping 3 inches from the beach that every shark in the facinity is either on it's way or already swimming around you. in a 1v1 situation a shark isn't much of a match even under the water, however simply thinking about how f@#$%! you could find yourself given that 2 or 3 seconds your back is turned is thrilling and i'm enjoying the game regardless of all the bugs i've encountered so far, (that being said other than the comments on connection issues some people seem to be having, almost every bug i've come across you can typically work around or psuedo-fix to get the job done (raft's in particular)

Overall I have allot of faith in, and expectations for the game and the devs are meeting my standards quite well

Considering how early the game is at this given time and how much more i do indeed have to progress i give it a 7.5/10 

Much more fulfilling than Rust imo.

review: well i like the game but if you watch the video put out to promote the game and then play it you will be very sad bc its not even the same as what they show sharks dont bite you like they did in video citys not there seeing under water ya right thats a joke like i said not the same game but still fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198044715776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3363, 'last_played': 1518389698}
review:
Intialy was excited about this game but after seeing what it has to offer I suggest to not waste your money. It's another generic survival game with absolutely no ambition. It is of my opinion that these type of games are only made so the devs can make a quick buck and then abandon it.

As for the game itself...

The map is very bare bones and does not have the apartment buildings that are shown in the second advertised video. Official servers (dominated by non-english speaking asians) hosted by a crappy host and the private ones by immature power abusing admins. Join a game and you will be killed on sight as there are absolutely no incentives for team work. The low poly almost 2d AI sharks are beyond a joke and are more of an annoynance. This game looks like it was made with an old version of Unity. Oh and i also forgot to mention their is a big hacking problem as there is currently no anti-cheat.

A "Waterworld" version of rust sound good in concept, but I'd rather watch Kevin Costners movie than waste my time with this game. This is no waterworld, the map is far too small. 

In my opinion the game is very rushed and should have been in atleast another 6 months of development before even being considered for a steam early access release.

I score it 4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113505346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1505196901}
review:
Это было 12 апреля 2016
Отличная игра для любителей серии игр таких как RUST, 7 Days to Die и многих других выживалок. Покупая её помните что игра в ранней альфе и некоторые недоработки лишь временны(летающие акулы). Игра вышла в стим не столь давно но уже начала вызывать бурный интерес у игрового сообщества steam. Графика посредственная надеемся будут доработки. Хочу заметить для альфы игра выдалась крайне интересной, играть одному скучно и не интересно если берете игру для себя возьмите пару копий для друзей так будет продуктивнее сэкономите массу времени и сил на тот же сбор ресурсов для выживания. Игра так же подойдет для тех кто хочет снять стресс от повседневной рутины. Все только начинается...
Сейчас на дворе 14.09.2017
Что бы не утверждал разработчик сервера пустые все осталось на прежднем уровне смысла вкладывать в проект и терять время не вижу. из плюсов летающих акул разработчик все таки убрал по мне так проект умер.
30.09.2017 Разработчик извинился перед всеми вложившимися в игру и помахал ручкой.
Я все понимаю но за то время пока разработчик мял булки один в начале проекта он мог отреагировать быстро и  нанять группу разработчиков и поднять проект на новый уровень. Как только обновления перестали поступать народ начал отходить от темы и естественно не покупать игру. Как итог кончилось все печально. Игровой проект встал колом и разработчик продолжает мять булки за то время как проект вышел денег у человека нет так же как и новых идей ПРОЕКТ ЗАГНУЛСЯ СЕРВЕРОВ НЕТ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055711333', 'num_games_owned': 956, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1653568606}
review:
I jumped into this game purely out of curiousity and my experience was alright actually.

First thing I noticed going into the game was the graphics. I definitely felt like most of these textures and objects were some of the default textures but I looked past the graphics since the game is in alpha. The server I spent my time in was nice and quiet since I am not big into PVP in survival games so I was really able to explore and figure out the mechanics of the game since there is not really any instruction or tutorial to the game. The next thing that caught me off guard a little is the fact the if you get sharks close enough to land they will literally begin to fly around in the air as though they are swimming and will follow you relentlessly which one did to me for a lot longer than I appreciated. The day and night cycle is nicely spaced out although nights are VERY dark and whenever I tried to go into options I was instantly faced with a "Are you sure you want to keep these settings" screen which left me unable to actually change anything. The game is nice enough to start you off with a pickaxe and a flashlight at least so you are not completely alone in the dark. The game follows pretty much any other survival game mechanic in that you must salvage metals and wood to build however one thing I really appreciated about this game is that you do not need to build every tiny item in order to build your goal item. If you want to build bolts to build a door you can, otherwise if you have the material needed to build the bolts and the door already then you can just build the door and the bolts will be constructed automatically as well. It took me a while to figure out how to build a base in order to fully feel safe in this game but I appreciated how blind I felt to everyhting. For still being in alpha I can recommend this game. It is the right amount of challenging and fun and as long as the developers keep to their word about the future additions I can see myself playing more of this.

review:
노 추천!! 러스트하다가 이거 하시면 후회막심..

+ 자물쇠 아직없네요 집지으나 마나 그냥 털려요..
+ 자물쇠가 있긴있는데...전기로 돌려야 해서 겁나 파밍해아함..(즉 밧데리 구하고 전기선 만들고 등등 겁나 파밍...)
+ 보트 만들려고 겁나 파밍했더니 뒤에서 누가 와서 타고감. 어이상실.
+ 맵이 넓은 평야가 아니라 섬으로 구현되어있음. 아주 조그만한 섬이 몇백개 있음;;(가까운 거리 같은경우는 상관이 없는데...약간                    만 멀어서 상어 나타나서 물려 죽음) 섬끼리 나무다리 연결되어 있는데 그냥 짜증..
+ 그냥 딱 시작하면 시작부터 마음에 안듬...

아직 개발중이라서  구현안되있는게 많아요. 왠지 느낌상 1년은 되야 완성될듯하네요. 러스트 처럼...

review: Game says "Hide & Hold Out is a multiplayer survival game taking place in a devastated water world." what you actally find is "Hide & Hold Out is a multiplayer survival game taking place in a devastated island chain." also the map is laughably small with it only being 8km by 8km if you need a reference point chernarus from Arma 2 is 225 km2. review:
[11-apr-16]
I believe the release of this game was premature.
I cant even setup a server to test the game because i cant connect, i am also unable to connect to a majority of the public servers out there, no point spending $15 on a game you cant play ... or hold out until they fix some issues.
The devs are very active (2 man team can only do so much, kudos to them) and i am more than happy to give them my $15 to help develop the game, but at this stage i believe people should wait a few months until things get settled.

I will update this review once i am able to use the game more.

Update [24/Aug/2019]
Game has been abandoned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009624416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1460358541}
review:
Ich schreibe mal auf Deutsch, denn ja, es soll auch Deutsche geben, die dieses Spiel in ihrem Besitz haben, oder es erwerben möchten ...

Vorweg: Ich werde es wieder zurückgeben, denn ich bin damit überhaupt nicht zufrieden.
Erstmal kommt man als Noob auf einen Server und es dauert keine 60s da wird man schon von den Helden des Spiels über den Haufen geschossen - keine Zeit mal was zu probieren oder sonst was. Wiedereinstieg im Wasser - 2 sec. wieder gestorben, weil ich versucht habe in Sand zu tauchen. Aha ... Dann mal etwas länger drin gewesen, kaum Holz gefunden. Ein Log im Wasser, versucht vom Raft zu looten. Raft macht sich selbstständig und man kann nichts mehr machen, also im Ofen nichts mehr brennen und dergleichen. Also Spiel wieder neu starten mit nix im Inventar und dem obligatorischen Tauchen im Sand. Außerdem ist mir dieses stetige schwimmen und suchen nach scrap viel zu eintönig - zumal die Felseninseln vllt. schön anzusehen sind, aber letztendlich auf Dauer ebenfalls langweilig wirken.

Liebe Devs, ihr müsst noch einige nacharbeiten, wenn es ein Hit werden soll.

PS. Dies ist meine pers. Meinung und muss keinesfalls andere Meinungen wiederspiegeln. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197973945046', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1461502735}
review:
サバイバルゲーの基本のごとく世界のどこかに放り出されます。
そこで資源を集めて装備を整えてといつものサバイバルゲーなのですが、
特徴としては海の面積が非常に多いこと。島伝いに資源を回収しましょう。

おっと、喜び勇んで海に入ろうとするそこのあなた落ち着いてください。
このゲームにはいつものアレがいます。そう、サメです。またサメです。
外人は何でこんなにサメ好きなのか小一時間問い詰めたい気分でいっぱいです。
でも安心してください、初期装備に小型ボートが支給されているので
それを設置して移動しましょう。

7ｄｔ7みたいにすべてのものが壊せるわけではないので
小盛になってるごみや海に漂う木を壊して資源を集めてください。
そうして資源をある程度集めたら拠点を作りましょう。
拠点を作る場所については好き好きあると思いますので細かくは書きませんが
一言だけ油田の近くはガチで死ぬ。拠点を立てたら資源を集めつつ拠点を拡張したり、他のプレーヤーを襲って資源を略奪したりといつものMOサバイバルゲームを楽しんでください。
なお敵は今のところサメと他のプレーヤーしかいないため
夜は完全な意味の無い時間帯になっています。

author: {'steamid': '76561198057988972', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 3583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3050, 'last_played': 1529913901}
review:
9-8-17 | Developer stopped developing. Dead. Not worth anymore.





UPDATED 5/31/17 - The game is alive and well, problems fixed, and is currently on sale for ten dollars. BUY IT! You won't be disappointed. No more hackers, the lone dev is working hard and even comes into servers and interacts with everyone and listens. The new update is fantastic! Get it and play it!







UPDATED - 3/17/17 - The game is still dead, however I think now would be a fantastic time to consider buying the game since the lone developer is releasing an update after what seems to have been a dispute I am guessing between him and the other dev who left. The new update is supposed to be pretty big and seems very promising. There was also a small update last week fixing some bugs, etc.


UPDATED - 10/24/16 - The game seems to have died out a lot. Not that much fun when there are only two other people on the server. Has potential still, keep an eye on it, just hold off on buying it for now. 

Old Review - 

I have decided to update my review now that I've logged more time into this game.

Firstly, this game is absolutely awesome, especially for an early access game. Plus, the devs are constantly updating it, communicating with the community, and trying their best to work out bugs.

This game is pretty much water world Rust, but that is ok because it really does a good job at it. The water looks stunning, there is a lot of land and ocean to explore, plenty of ways to build bases, things to craft, players to meet, and things to do. I personally love this game.

In terms of performance, the game runs very very well. I am not sure, but I do believe there is a 60 FPS cap but that is fine since the majoity of people only have 60hz refresh rate monitors. The game is not demanding at all. I run this game in Ultra all them time, as well as my friends, and some have lower end PC's and they don't get any frame issues. 

Servers are very good for the most part: Good population, good players, good ping. On some servers there are a few hackers/duppers. They duplicate items and will teleport you, but they are very rare and are mostly asian. (Korean I think)

Definetely give this game a go. If you don't like it, refund it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160072872', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3891, 'last_played': 1527638670}
review: Всем привет, на данный момент можно просто зайти и полюбопытствовать, но ничего особенного , каких то отличий от других выживалок нет.Игра очень сырая с кучей багов.Конечно есть потенциал, ну это как обычно. Но зато на сегодняшный день есть такой минус всем минусам минус: любой чужой игрок на серве за три минуты застроит вашу базу т.к. отсутствует приват территории и не поплыть вам, не полетать и не выйти, весь труд и время в жопу.Так что думаю надо ждать обновлений с исправлением этого.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214252905', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1460383210}
review:
Ко мне подплывает чувак,
Но я не пойму почему..
Кричит он, что мол не враг,
А я же поверил ему...
Всё ближе ко мне, он всё ближе,
Плывёт монохромный товарищ!
Поможет мне стать он повыше,
И чаю мы с ним подзаварим. 
Но вместо добрых слов,
И тёплого признания.
Он достаёт свой нож,
И бьёт без залипания.
Один удар, другой..
Пытаюсь я уплыть...
Ну почему со мной,
Никто не хочет жить.
Здесь большинство играет,
С друзьями - группами,
И карта здесь большая,
Для всех кусками крупными.
Впредь будьте аккуратней, 
Игра пять из пяти.
Акулы там и баржи,
И люди - не люди!!!
@Universe

review: H2O - это игра, где ты отходишь от плота на 1 минуту, а возвращаясь видишь как какой-то упырь уплывает на нем. 10 Спизженных плотов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198038570177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1498891456}
review:
Fun... while it lasts.

MAJOR COMPLAINT:  People can simply steal your stored inventory while you are away.  HOURS of gameplay lost.  Total BS.  It's one thing to have to deal with PVP while you are there, quite another when you cant be on for a few days, and everything you have is taken.

Anly a few bugs encountered in several hours of play... and then only minor...  server problems were a bit more of an issue.

Vehicles...

Plane:  Uhhhh.  No.  Just no.  the controls are horrid.   A pilot should assist the devs in aircraft behavior (Ill volunteer!).
Plane doesn't turn when banked... which is not good.  Plane noses up... when you push the mouse forward... exactly the opposite of what it should...  (devs!)

Water craft:  Jet ski, hovercraft work well and as you'd expect.  Standing up on the Jet ski sometimes tosses you in the drink, but no biggie...

Hovercraft is just plain ol fun.   Heavy gun turret available.

Crafting is nearly effortless.  Like it.  Well balanced.

Night is... well... *dark*, and there are no craftable lights... so when you are on your base at night... you'll be running around with flashligts.  Hope this is fixed soon.

Sharks can occasionally take to the air and fly like a scene from Sharknado... which is hillarious.

Decent variety of weapons/ammo.

I like the island layout the map has... it's not massive, but it's not small either.  A jet ski can cross it in under 5 minutes, I'd guess.

Building is not too difficult when you get how it works...  be sure to read the docs on the dev web site.

There are electrical systems, and "crop" farming of sorts.  Solves your food issues for sure, but one bug is that crops don't survive server resets.  Harvest and store regularly.

As mentioned, your stuff isn't safe while you are off the server.  Until this is fixed, it's a total deal breaker for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263224138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1460319936}
review: The pings are fake. Seems no SEA servers. Also i tried connecting to a server with 60ms and it kept on connecting connecting .... for more than half an hour. got piss*d off and applied for refund. May i will come back after the connection issues are fixed. Saw some game play videos in you tube has some potential it seems. But unable to enter the multiplayer its damn bad. Good luck to the dev team. All the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094628723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1460260273}
review:
No momento não recomendo a compra deste jogo, pois acho que tem muito a melhorar. Exemplos:

- Bugs como players invisíveis
- Bug de load infinito ao conectar em um servidor(dificilmente acontece)
- Pouco loot e processo de crafting complicado
- Gráficamente o jogo deixa muito a desejar, se comparado com os trailers
- Armas com dano muito desequilibrado
- Sistema de armas mal trabalhado
- Poucas construções e mapa muito mal trabalhado
- As ilhas são basicamente bancos de areia com pedras grandes e feias e algumas palmeiras

Não que o gráfico seja o mais importante, mas se comparado com os trailers deixa muito a desejar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011674389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1458078964}
review: I have been playing this game since early on in the closed alpha process. Both of the developers have put in countless hours and have really listened to the testers and worked hard to improved enjoyment for the community. That being said, this game is just fun, I have played thousands of hours of different survival and crafting based open world games. H2O brings a unique take to this genre with the focus on aquatic type vehicles and large group based combat. I cannot recommend this game more to anyone who is interested in these types of games. The game is incredibly enjoyable with a lot of room for improvement as well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112570778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2742, 'last_played': 1486504977}
review:
2016년 4월 11일 새벽 3시 기준으로 제가 유일한 한국어 평가군요.

한국어 평가가없어서 함부로 구매못하시는 한국인들 있으신가요 ? 

이게임은 러스트+해적  조합해놓은듯한 게임인데요 .

그냥 한마디만 하겠습니다. 사세요. 

(단, 처음적응하는 한시간 은 재미없을 수 있습니다.)

ps .  사운드 업데이트 많이해야겠어요 ~ 건물 부수는소리 , 광물캐는소리 , 땅때리는소리 , 사람때리는소리  ,보트 때리는소리 ,철때리는 소리 , 나무 때리는소리 심지어 바닷물 때리는소리 까지 다 똑같은건 너무하자나 ㅜ



//


네  저위에 평가는 제가 5시간정도했을때 평가구요 지금은 37.7시간정도 하고나서 하는 평가인데 

게임성자체는 조금만 손보고 업그레이드 시키면 

정말 여태본게임중 손꼽는 게임이 될꺼같습니다.

러스트 , 하이즈 , 데이즈 ,트리오브라이프 ,더포레스트 .돈스티브  ,레인 오브 킹즈 

생존게임은 다해봤지만 이렇게 재밌는 게임은 별로 없었습니다 그런데..

공식서버가 있는건진 모르겠지만 제가 여태하던 서버들은 다들 개인이 여는 개인서버 더군요 . 

한달에 3만5천원 꼴 주고 서버 열수 있더군요 

문제는 비리가 폭주한다는겁니다. 

어드민 비위나 살살 맞춰주는 애들한테 템을주던가 그상대세력을 벤시켜주던가 . 

그런 일이 번번히 있다보니 공식섭 나오기전깐지 추천하기 꺼려지네요.

또한 지금 게임에있어서 가장 치명적인 버그는  

러스트처럼 건설차단이라는 개념이없어서  

다른사람집을 마음만먹으면 망쳐놓을수있는 버그라고 말하겠습니다.



//


한국팀 모집합니다 ~ 같이하실분 스팀친추주세요 ~

author: {'steamid': '76561198068663507', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1458896132}
review:
It's a good game,a lot like Rust and I can tell you a lot about rust I have played it to death (400+ hours)
Except it has Vehicles,Boats,Helicopters and lot more (in a way)
Also some people report it having bad optimisations but it works fine A-Okay on my laptop on medium to high!

Also it's launch day if you are saying the ping is high and stuff..maybe give it a day to stabilise?
We have seen worse AAA title launches.
The bugs will be fixed,dupe glitches will be removed,people will move on to play it.
I think it deserves a buy and is a game that will just get better over time!

Score-7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197984977321', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1460308937}
review:
This game has a long way to go before its in any sort of playable state (that doesn't involve constant dying to invisible players). Combat is buggy, Gameplay is lackluster, and the map is rather small for how quickly you can traverse it on a makeshift raft (which you spawn in with). Rather small in this instance is that you can travel from one corner of the map to the other in about 10 minutes real time (to give you some perspective), on that starting raft. 

Current max players is 40, which is sufficient for the map size, but that player count will need to increase with the map size (I read that there are plans to increase the size and player count in the future).

The biggest challenge you will face is dying to people that aren't there. It may be desync, or something along those lines, but if you can't see someone, how can you survive their attacks? 

After a few patches it may be a better place in regards to the invisible player issue (hopefully the duping and placing objects on your friends to push them through other players walls is also fixed), but I would hold out for a while until there are more releases for this very very Early Access game. There are also issues with the camera clipping through walls (other players viewing into your base, you viewing theirs).

Maybe I'll come back to it in the future if these issues are addressed...

author: {'steamid': '76561198142058951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1467221636}
review:
Скучали по Раст Легаси? Вот вам - новая survival игрушка Hide & Hold Out - H2o! На мой неопытный взгляд, в игре прекрасно все )) много разнообразного крафта, интересный сеттинг - этакий водный мир с Кевином Костнером, только без Кевина Костнера. Отличная оптимизация - первое, что бросается в глаза, куча идей у разработчиков - игра будет расти и расширяться. Есть претензии по качеству текстур - пока все немного угловато, но только в плане графики, - сам игровой процесс отлажен на 5 с плюсом. Короче, считаю, что разработчиков нужно поддержать и брать игру. 9 из 10 (минус балл за простенькую графику, но, ее еще подкрутят)
Тут первое видео: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C_IjUTSK7Zs

review:
-Spawn in a gorgeous-looking world.
-Notice I'm on an island.
-Run around for a while, until I notice I've got a raft in my inventory.
-Board the raft, and go out to sea.
-See treasure at the bottom of the sea.
-Immediately dive down to fetch treasure
-It's very dark, but I'm determined to get the treasure.
-Hear something behind me, think it's nothing.
-Turn around, THERE'S A MOTHERFUCKING SHARK.
-I scream, loudly. Family thinks I'm dying.
-10/10, Would scream again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135627947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1460728403}
review:
Having followed the Game for a while and playing for a couple hours over the past months, I can say that progress has been made. Theres definetely potential for this game to find it's niche in the survival/crafting genre and the game allows for cool bases to be built and combat to be had.

I myself was able to build a pretty neat base and engage into some fun combat interactions with others. I can't wait to see what this game will end up being! I hope it will be as good as the devs want it to be! 

Keep in mind that the game is Early Access and needs your help to become the best it can be! The devs are very open to suggestions and feedback so if you opt in to support this game feel free to let them know what you think would be cool features for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119896660', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1497591607}
review: Hide & Hold Out-H20-Это именно та игра которую я очень долго ждал.Водный мир-фильм-вот концепция,основа этой игры .Крафтинг,морские сражения,добыча,строительство и много другое.На раннем стадии,ещё до раннего доступа (на закрытом альфа тесте)игра имела основу(крафт,водный мир)Сейчас в игре имеется куча всего(огромный выбор крафтинга,отличная оптимизация,добыча ресурсов,электричество,судо строение(корабля,катера,лодки и.т.д)ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО ВСЕГО!!!.Играть со своими друзьями одно удовольствие-рейды,строительство базы,создание клана и.т.д.Можно сказать,это почти идеальная игра со своими + и -.Но минусов на столько мало,что хочется сказать огромное спасибо разработчикам этой прекрасной игры за проделанную работу(тем более что она только выйдет в ранний доступ).Стоит покупать?-Однозначно ДА.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053422627', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 1237, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1460253916}
review:
This game is a very unoptimized game and will KILL your rig even on basic settings with medium textures and simple water etc.  I couldn't play it worth a crap (8-12 fps) on a Quad Core 3.4 GHZ CPU, GeForce 750Ti, and 8 GB of Ram..  Can't even imagine higher graphics settings.

I'm sure it's fun on a beast gaming rig, but the recommended and minimum specs seem to be total BS, you'll want a much better PC then what's it states to run this game well.  Just a FYI.  

I will re-review this game on a higher end gaming PC and after some optimization has been done by the devs.  However, right now I cannot recommend any survival game that is this demanding, especially when so many good survival games are obviously so much better optimized, and they are in early access as well (Rust, Hurtworld, The Culling, etc)

author: {'steamid': '76561198107126911', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1510208330}
review:
I Should really re write this review as the game as some big issues. First off Hide and Hold out had a really bad start. They had to remove one of the things that made the game so great, The City. I was part of the beta testing team and I'll tell you, that was fun. however due to optimizing and unity being anoying the city had to be removed along with a lot of the fun. Since then H20 has been plaqued with hackers and now has little to no one playing. which is a really big shame considering this game is very good and just needs some changes.

we've all heard the term "Has potential" but it DOES apply with Hide and Hold out. 

Youve done really well making H20 Neist so dont give up, this game can still be amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051864913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1460329567}
review:
7/10
DISCLAIMER: I was given an alpha testing key 
Hide & Hold Out - H2o is the embodiment of Waterworld(1995). There are jetskis, gunboats, makeshift cargoships, rusting battleships, HELICOPTERS, PLANES!!! The landscape is a warzone, no one is safe. Only the boldest of players will be able to overcome the struggle of living in this chaotic enviornment. 

Keep in mind however that this game is still a work in progress. There are aesthetic problems that eek me like how hip firing the ak47 feels like shooting out of a broomstick. Not to mention the physics seem 'odd' at the very least. For example, a player can dive into the water with the jet ski, flip upside down while still on the jet ski and not submerge into the water script wise or suffer some form of consequences. 

More so I wish that player built buildings could be destroyed by other players. I learned this the hard way when I wasted 7 rockets attempting to infiltrate a base under siege by my clan. At least we destroyed their recon copter and jet skis though XD. 

Overall, when you guys play this game. Keep an open mind. I hope ya'll have a fun time and I hope to see you on the battlefield.
